title: DARE Update Custom Preferences
description: Use to customise DARE Update user prompt preferences.

deferralOption.title: Select a Deferral Option
deferralOption.description: Use to define behaviour around update deferrals. To allow the user to continue deferring with no limit and force the update on-demand, select Disable Deferral Limit. To set a limit on the amount of allowed deferrals, select Specify Deferral Limit. Alternatively, you can disable deferrals completely by selecting Disable Deferrals, which will only allow a grace period for updates

specifyLimit.title: Deferral Limit
specifyLimit.description: Specify a custom deferral limit. The default deferral limit if not specified is 2

runType.title: Run Limitation Option
runType.description: This defines when to prompt users to install any pending updates. You can either limit user prompts to a specified weekly patch day, or alternatively select a frequency to prompt the users, e.g., once every 2 weeks

singlePromptMode.title: Single Prompt Mode
singlePromptMode.description: When enabled, DARE Update will only prompt the user once after the specified frequency time period has elapsed even if the user defers the update. When disabled, if the specified frequency time period has elapsed, the user will be prompted to update every time the launch daemon runs DARE Update until the user installs the pending updates

patchDay.title: Patch Day
patchDay.description: The day of the week to prompt users to install cached updates

missedUpdatePrompt.description: When enabled, DARE Update will prompt the user to update whenever the device comes back online if it was offline on the defined patch day. A launch daemon to run DARE Update on a daily recurring basis must be configured for this to work. Alternatively, leave this unchecked to wait until the next patch day to prompt the user if their device was offline on the previous patch day
missedUpdatePrompt.title: Missed Update Prompts

singlePatchDayPrompt.description: When enabled, DARE Update will ensure the user is only prompted once on the configured patch day if there are pending updates. This allows you to configure the launch daemon to run DARE Update on a recurring basis during patch day, meaning that if an acceptable use scenario causes the prompt to skip, DARE Update can continue attempting to prompt the user on the next run. After successfully prompting the user, DARE Update will ensure no further prompts are displayed until the next patch day if the update was deferred. Alternatively, leave unchecked if you plan to prompt the user on a recurring basis on the configured patch day
singlePatchDayPrompt.title: Single Patch Day Prompt

gracePeriodMinutes.title: Grace Period in Minutes
gracePeriodMinutes.description: The amount of time a user is given to save work before updates are installed automatically when there are no remaining deferrals. Default is 15 minutes

customIcon.title: Custom Icon
customIcon.description: A custom icon to be displayed on the user prompts. The default is the Self Service icon

initialPromptOverlayIcon.title: Initial Prompt Icon Overlay
initialPromptOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on the initial update prompts. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

customInitialPromptSize.title: Custom Initial Prompt Size
customInitialPromptSize.description: Use to customise the size of the initial prompt displayed to users when they can either defer or update. Note: Only configure this setting if defining custom prompt messages. If you are using the default prompt messages, customising prompt size is not recommended as the default prompt size is pre-configured to correctly match the size of the default message displayed

promptHeight.description: Use to define a custom height in points for the prompts shown to users, e.g., 330
promptHeight.title: Custom prompt height

promptWidth.description: Use to define a custom width in points for the prompts shown to users, e.g., 640
promptWidth.title: Custom prompt width

customGracePromptSize.title: Custom Grace Period Prompt Size
customGracePromptSize.description: Use to customise the size of the grace period timer prompt shown when users have no remaining deferrals. Note: Only configure this setting if defining custom prompt messages. If you are using the default prompt messages, customising prompt size is not recommended as the default prompt size is pre-configured to correctly match the size of the default message displayed

promptHeight.description: Use to define a custom height in points for the prompts shown to users, e.g., 330
promptHeight.title: Custom prompt height

promptWidth.description: Use to define a custom width in points for the prompts shown to users, e.g., 640
promptWidth.title: Custom prompt width

singleAppTitle.title: Custom Single App Title
singleAppTitle.description: A custom title to be displayed on the user prompts when there is 1 pending App update

multipleAppsTitle.title: Custom Multiple Apps Title
multipleAppsTitle.description: A custom title to be displayed on the user prompts when there is more than 1 pending App update

singleInitialQuitPromptMessage.title: Single App Initial Quit Prompt Message
singleInitialQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is 1 pending App update and the App can quit to update. This prompt offers the option to defer update

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires the App to quit...

multipleInitialQuitPromptMessage.title: Multiple Apps Initial Quit Prompt Message
multipleInitialQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is multiple pending App updates and the Apps can quit to update. This prompt offers the option to defer update

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Important updates are pending which require Apps to quit...

singleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.title: Single App Grace Period Quit Prompt Message
singleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there is 1 pending update and the App can quit to update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

multipleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.title: Multiple Apps Grace Period Quit Prompt Message
multipleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there are multiple pending updates and the Apps can quit to update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining. The Apps which require an update will be listed below this message

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

singleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.title: Single App Initial Log Out Prompt Message
singleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is 1 pending App update and the App requires a Log Out to update. This prompt offers the option to Defer or Log out

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires a Log Out...

multipleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.title: Multiple Apps Initial Log Out Prompt Message
multipleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there are multiple pending App updates and one or more Apps require a Log Out to update. This prompt offers the option to Defer or Log Out

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, A Log Out is required for one or more of the Apps listed...

singleAppGracePeriodLogOutMessage.title: Single App Grace Period Log Out Prompt Message
singleAppGracePeriodLogOutMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there is one pending update and the App requires a Log Out update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

multipleAppGracePeriodLogOutMessage.title: Multiple Apps Grace Period Log Out Prompt Message
multipleAppGracePeriodLogOutMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there are multiple pending updates and one or more Apps require a Log Out to update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

customDeferButton.title: Custom Defer Button
customDeferButton.description: A custom Defer button displayed on prompts where deferrals are allowed

customUpdateButton.title: Custom Update Button
customUpdateButton.description: A custom Update button label displayed on prompts where Apps can quit to update

customLogOutButton.title: Custom Log Out Button
customLogOutButton.description: A custom Log Out button label displayed on prompts where Apps require a Log Out to update

appListType.title: App List Type
appListType.description: Determines how to display the list of Apps on the update prompts. Apps can either be displayed in a vertical scrollable list beneath the prompt message, or displayed horizontally as part of the prompt message. When using the horizontal list option, the list of Apps is stored in the appList variable

refreshInterval.title: Prompt Refresh Interval
refreshInterval.description: The amount of time in seconds the user prompts refresh. The prompts require a refresh to pull focus if the user swipes away to ignore the prompt and ensures they either select defer or update. The default value is 20 seconds. The minimum allowed value is 10 seconds

acceptableAppBundleIDs.title: Acceptable App Bundle IDs
acceptableAppBundleIDs.description: Application Bundle IDs specified here will prevent DARE Update from prompting users to update if the App(s) are identified as being active in the foreground (You can specify one or more Bundle IDs). To get Bundle IDs, enter the following in terminal (replacing Safari with the relevant App): defaults read /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/Info.plist CFBundleIdentifier

acceptableCameraUsage.title: Acceptable Camera Usage
acceptableCameraUsage.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if the camera is in use. Note: Apple Silicon Macs running macOS 12 (Monterey) do not accurately report camera usage, therefore this setting will be ignored. Upgrading to macOS 13 (Ventura) will resolve this issue for Apple Silicon Macs.

acceptableScreenSharing.title: Acceptable Screen Sharing Usage
acceptableScreenSharing.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if Screen Sharing is in use.

performLogoutUpdates.title: Perform Logout Updates
performLogoutUpdates.description: By default, DARE Update will perform all updates regardless of whether the update requires a Log Out. To have DARE Update only prompt users when no Log Out is required, set this option as false (not recommended)

updateProgressPosition.title: Quit Update Progress Position
updateProgressPosition.description: The position on the screen of the prompt which displays the progress of an App-quit update. The default position is top right.

updateProgressFocus.title: Quit Update Progress Prompt Focus
updateProgressFocus.description: Determines whether the quit update progress prompt is always on top during quit updates. True makes the prompt appear on top of any other Apps, False will allow other apps to be on top of the progress prompt

updateProgressOverlayIcon.title: Update Progress Prompt Overlay Icon
updateProgressOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on prompt shown during the App updates. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon, which on this prompt is the App icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

displayCompletePrompt.title: Display Complete Message
displayCompletePrompt.description: Determines whether a prompt is displayed to the user to inform them that the updates are complete. The prompt will inherit the same window position as the Update Progress prompt. Default is true

customIcon.title: Custom Icon
customIcon.description: A custom icon to be displayed on the user prompts. The default when not specified is the icon of the App being forced to update

initialPromptOverlayIcon.title: Initial Prompt Overlay Icon
initialPromptOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on the initial or grace period update prompts. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon, which on this prompt is the App icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

customInitialPromptSize.description: Use to customise the size of the initial prompt displayed to users when they can either defer or update. Note: Only configure this setting if defining custom prompt messages. If you are using the default prompt messages, customising prompt size is not recommended as the default prompt size is pre-configured to correctly match the size of the default message displayed

customTitle.description: A custom title to be displayed on the initial force update prompts which are shown prior to the updates running, e.g the defer/update prompt (if configured) or the grace period prompt

initialQuitPromptMessage.title: Initial Quit Prompt Message
initialQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial force update prompt shown when Apps can quit to update. This prompt offers the option to defer updates

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Important updates are pending which require Apps to quit...

initialLogOutPromptMessage.title: Initial Log Out Prompt Message
initialLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial force update prompt shown when Apps require a Log Out to update. This prompt offers the option to defer updates

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Important updates are pending which require a Log Out...

gracePeriodQuitPromptMessage.title: Grace Period Quit Prompt Message
gracePeriodQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when Apps can quit to update and there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

gracePeriodLogOutPromptMessage.title: Grace Period Log Out Prompt Message
gracePeriodLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when Apps require a Log Out to update and there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click Log Out...
